forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Juneteenth
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a chill whispers through the streets, laying an invitation for the day ahead. The skies have begun with a gentle clarity, allowing the city to awaken under a backdrop of mostly clear heavens, where the air breathes coolness at a low of fifty-three. With the sun's ascent, the day promises warmth, reaching a peak near sixty-two before softly retreating to the comfort of sixty in the afternoon. The west wind briskly dances at speeds of nine to twenty-four miles per hour, occasionally gusting up to thirty-one, adding a playful edge to the morning.

Though the early hours may seem serene, one can almost sense the marine layer lingering not far away, a subtle reminder of the coast’s embrace. As the sun begins to command its territory, expect patches of fog to retreat to more sheltered corners of the Bay Area, but remain prepared for its return later. In this fresh atmosphere, dressing in layers becomes a prudent choice; a light jacket or sweater over a T-shirt will serve you well, allowing for comfort as temperatures fluctuate. The city beckons for leisurely strolls along the waterfront or a visit to one of the local cafés, where you can sip a warm beverage and watch the morning unfold. A visit to a nearby bookstore or wandering through Golden Gate Park can offer warmth to both body and soul, making the most of a day imbued with the promise of sunshine and the invigorating embrace of the breeze.
